text:
I think its whether you have submitted or not to a section. In any case if you want feel free to try:
```(George Datseris should forward this email to someone who's registered
as an endorser for the <http://nlin.CG|nlin.CG> (Cellular Automata and Lattice Gases)
subject class of arXiv.)

George Datseris requests your endorsement to submit an article to the
<http://nlin.CG|nlin.CG> section of arXiv. To tell us that you would (or would not) like
to endorse this person, please visit the following URL:

<https://arxiv.org/auth/endorse?x=BEGXDX>

If that URL does not work for you, please visit

<http://arxiv.org/auth/endorse.php>

and enter the following six-digit alphanumeric string:

Endorsement Code: BEGXDX```

text: I published in a couple of different sections, I don't remember having to ask for the endorsement.  I often see people asking for endorsement, I just don't understand why I didn't have to :sweat_smile:

text: Ah, I see, I would need 4 papers somewhere in nlin to help, which I do not have (I am only 4 papers short of that :wink: )

text: Mosé well a few years back it was not needed, and now if you post to a new group/category you might need that depending on how far away it is from your previous groups/categories

text: as far as I see I could endorse any math or CS category but not nlin. But well; I even once got an email from some guy – unknown to me – asking whether I would endorse his strange paper. He got a not that happy response from me.

text: Thanks Ronny, I'll try to go to the CS category and ask for endorsement there. So far arXiv seems to be lagging a lot, I'll have to try later to see the category pop up :slightly_smiling_face: haha year weird unknown emails are both funny and infuriating
